The Alliance base is in perfect conditions, Dachande.

To JP: The whole idea behind the mobile base rule is that you can't 
fly a base to a battle, attack with it, and retreat, like what was 
happening before the rule was passed. Your sub is completely going 
against that. And if you look closely, the IF's main advantage is 
that its on an island, not its defences (which are about as good as 
the CF's anyways).

Mobile base means that bases can't move and be bases at the same 
times. THe Alliance base wasn't functional when it was moved, it 
wasn't even together. A moving powerful sub is a completely different 
matter.

::Zardus::

Zardus growls, snapping his head toward Cybershark as he grabbed 
Zergling. Looking at his wrist comp to see the Iron Fist's report on 
what was happening, he looks back at Cybershark.

"Kill him," he says, firing his plasma launcher at Cybershark. The 
island defences as well as the Iron Fist's own defences target 
Cybershark, a horde of laser shots and a lot of missiles streaming 
toward the bot.

The shuttles carrying the pieces of the Alliance base lift further 
up, careful to avoid weapon fire.

Zardus glances down at his wrist comp, looking through other scanner 
report. The Predacons were back at their base, and at a spot near the 
sea...

He frowns. He'd have to investigate that later.




--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "dachande" <Dachande85@m...> wrote:
> ::CyberShark/Zergling::
> 
>     They met outside of what used to be the Alliance base. (If it 
was destroyed then they weren't in it, I shouldn't be punished for my 
father not getting e-mail back until last night.) CyberShark looked 
at Zergling, and saw the mindlessness there. He smiled.
>     He walked over to Zergling and grabbed him. Zergling fought 
back, but to no use. CyberShark opened his head panel and started to 
reprogramm him.
>     A couple of hours later Zergling was reprogrammed. He now 
served CyberShark unquestiongly, but maintained a face of loyality to 
Zardus.
